sentences.english: It's about ten minutes' walk from school to our home every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天從黌舍到我們家步止除夜約需供十分鐘。

sentences.english: On my way there, I thought about the village, the school and the children there.
sentences.chinese: 在自己地途中，自己想到啦村莊，黌舍和那邊地孩子。

sentences.english: He created a new record in hellogh-jump at our school sports.
sentences.chinese: 在咱們黌舍的運動會上，他創造了跳高新紀錄。

sentences.english: students attend a boarding school would cultivate their independence as apart from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 分開怙恃上寄宿黌舍的學生將會培育他們的自力性。

sentences.english: The school challenged us to a game of football.
sentences.chinese: 那所黌舍向本人們應戰賽場足球。

sentences.english: I always remember the day when I first came to this school.
sentences.chinese: 我往往記得我第一次來黌舍的那一天。

sentences.english: Teluk Meranti's four schools serve chelloldren ages 5 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 德魯科梅蘭蒂的四所黌舍接收5到18歲的孩子。

sentences.english: on the other hand, the contribution of day schools can't be ignored.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，日製黌舍的進獻是不克不及輕忽的。

sentences.english: Mr Liu is of the best teachers in our school.
sentences.chinese: 劉教授是我們黌舍最好的教授之一。

sentences.english: I didn't dare to stop, so I ran quickly toward the school.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢停下來，所以就飛快地朝黌舍跑去。

sentences.english: A leader is the head of a school, or enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 率領是一個黌舍或企業的頭頭。

sentences.english: A school sports, I participated in the women's 400-meter relay.
sentences.chinese: 一次黌舍活動會上，我加入了女子400米接力競走。

sentences.english: In the past 10 years, great changes have taken place in our school.
sentences.chinese: 在曩昔的10年裏，我們黌舍發生了複雜的改變。

sentences.english: While trying to avoid the rain, he meets another school girl.
sentences.chinese: 當東浩想避雨時，他看見第二間黌舍地女孩。

sentences.english: Many of the schools were built with inadequate reinforcements, prompting public outrage.
sentences.chinese: 許多黌舍修建尺度分歧劃定，導致了黎庶的憤慨。

sentences.english: Then, I ran into her last year while attending an annual convention at the University.
sentences.chinese: 然後，去年我在加入黌舍年會時重逢了她。

definition: groom or chariot driver employed by a noble (old)
operculum (Latin: little lid)/a covering flap (in various branches of anatomy)
